page.title: 17WADENHOE VILLAGE
page.content: With 101 people in 1981, Wadenhoe village is quite large compared to most settlements in this area.The main industry in the area is farming. The village has a pub, craftshop and a post office where a few villagers also work. The pub is a quaint old English pub on the banks of the River Nene where boats are frequently moored. About half of the occupants of Wadenhoe have lived there all their lives. The remainder are new farmers and, as elsewhere in East Northamptonshire, people who have moved from large towns and cities. Most of these use their village cottages as holiday homes and for weekend breaks. Recent plans for a pop festival at Lilford Park were strongly opposed by the residents who were apprehensive of the possible impact of 25,000 pop-fans on Wadenhoe.
